page.title: 06MUSIC IN SCHOOL
page.content: In 1950, Mr. Bailey became headmaster of the school, fostering an interest in music which still continues today. He encouraged all children to take part in music, and began to learn to play the violin with his older pupils. The Country Dance Festival became an annual event, parents gathering with their children to enjoy many popular folk dances. Mr. Bailey also founded a festival, held every two years, when schools from outlying districts joined together for a day, in order to sing. Because of the closure of small schools this festival no longer exists, though Sir John Offley School presents a "Musical Evening" each year, in which children are encouraged to take part to perform for their parents. The school has a choir,a recorder group,a guitar group, and a number of children play woodwind,brass,strings,and keyboards.
